page.title: 16Lyewood Nursery,Ropley
page.content: Lyewood Nursery,Petersfield Road,has a plot of 5.7 acres of which 1.2 acres are glasshouses.It was built up from 1972 when the Carruthers family moved in and there were only poly-tunnels.It has been modernised since then with much new equipment the latest of which is a generator to produce power for heating and lighting if there is a power failure.Heating is from an oil -fired boiler and heating costs have gone up enormously.In Winter the main plants are cyclamen which are sold at Covent Garden Market,London.In Spring, the busiest time of the year,bedding plants are sold to garden centres.The nursery employs 6 people full time (which includes 3 from the family) and 8-13 part time workers at busy times of the year.All the money made in the business goes back into capital investment.
